trait.name: Dragon's Resistance
entries: Copperscale kobolds have resistance to acid damage.

trait.name: Heart of the Dragon
entries: If the kobold is {@condition frightened} or {@condition paralyzed} by an effect that allows a saving throw, it can repeat the save at the start of its turn to end the effect on itself and all kobolds within 30 feet of it. Any kobold that benefits from this trait (including the dragonshield) has advantage on its next attack roll.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The copperscale dragonshield has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the copperscale dragonshield's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the copperscale dragonshield has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Copperscale Dragonshield makes three melee attacks.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dart
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage in melee, or 5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage at range.
Copperscale Dragonshields are champions that help guard the lairs of Copper Dragons.

trait.name: Copperscale Drake
entries: A copperscale drake is amphibious (it can breathe air or water), has a swimming speed of 30 feet, and has resistance to acid damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drake makes two attacks: one with its bite and one with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.
Copperscale Drakes are often seen as mounts for Copperscale Kobolds.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The sorcerer is a 3rd-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 13}, +5 to hit with spell attacks). It has the following sorcerer spells prepared:

trait.name: Sorcery Points
entries: The sorcerer has 3 sorcery points. It can spend 1 or more sorcery points as a bonus action to gain one of the following benefits:

Distant Spell: When you cast a spell that has a range of 5 feet or greater, you can spend 1 sorcery point to double the range of the spell.  When you cast a spell that has a range of touch, you can spend 1 sorcery point to make the range of the spell 30 feet.
Subtle Spell: When the kobold casts a spell, it can spend 1 sorcery point to cast the spell without any somatic or verbal components.

trait.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
entries: While in sunlight, the copperscale kobold sorcerer has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The copperscale kobold sorcerer has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the copperscale kobold sorcerer's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The archer makes two attacks with its longbow.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Dragon's Breath (1/day)
entries: The Dragonborn breathes out a 15 ft. cone of fire.  Each creature inside the cone must make a Constitution Saving throw ({@dc 13}).  A creature takes ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one.

bonus.name: Archer's Eye (3/day)
entries: As a bonus action, the archer can add {@dice 1d10} to its next attack or damage roll with a longbow or shortbow.
Archers defend castles, hunt wild game on the fringes of civilization, serve as artillery in military units, and occasionally make good coin as brigands or caravan guards.

trait.name: Formation Tactics
entries: The soldier has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, {@condition frightened}, {@condition grappled}, or {@condition restrained} while it is within 5 feet of at least one ally.

trait.name: Dragon's Breath (1/day)
entries: The Dragonborn breathes out a 15 ft. cone of fire.  Each creature inside the cone must make a Constitution Saving throw ({@dc 12}).  A creature takes ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The soldier makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Spear
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage in melee, or 5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage at range, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage if used with both hands.

action.name: Shortbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.
Soldiers are found in many of Ravnica's guilds. The soldier stat block represents a typical member of the rank and file, though weaponry and armor can vary.

trait.name: Dragon's Breath
entries: The Dragonborn breathes out a 15 ft. cone of fire.  Each creature inside the cone must make a Constitution Saving throw ({@dc 10}).  A creature takes ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage on a failed save, and half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The veteran makes two longsword attacks. If it has a shortsword drawn, it can also make a shortsword attack.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage, or 8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) slashing damage if used with two hands.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Heavy Crossbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 100/400 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d10 + 1}) piercing damage.

Veterans are professional fighters that take up arms for pay or to protect something they believe in or value. Their ranks include soldiers retired from long service and warriors who never served anyone but themselves.

monster.name: Ghost, White Guard Drake
languages: understands Draconic but can't speak it

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The drake attacks twice, once with its bite and once with its tail.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) piercing damage and {@h}8 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage.

action.name: Tail
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage and {@h}8 ({@damage 2d8}) cold damage.
Ghost, is Kabu Zoss's companion drake.

trait.name: Lightfooted
entries: The swashbuckler can take the Dash or Disengage action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

trait.name: Suave Defense
entries: While the swashbuckler is wearing light or no armor and wielding no shield, its AC includes its Charisma modifier.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The hella has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the hella to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The swashbuckler makes three attacks: one with a dagger and two with its rapier.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage in melee, or 7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage at range.

action.name: Rapier
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Potion of Healing (2/Day)
entries: As a bonus action, Hella can drink a Potion of Healing to regain {@dice 2d4 + 2} hit points.
Valenar Swashbucklers are adventure-tier foes exceptionally skilled in duels.
Hella

action.name: Club
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) bludgeoning damage.
Commoners include peasants, serfs, slaves, servants, pilgrims, merchants, artisans, and hermits.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The hella has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the hella to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The warrior makes two attacks.

action.name: Double-Bladed Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, unlimited range, one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) damage.

bonus.name: Double Bladed Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage.
Valenar Warriors are adventure-tier foes commonly found in Valenar warbands.

trait.name: Brave
entries: The knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The valenar knight has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the valenar knight to sleep.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Leadership (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
entries: For 1 minute, the knight can utter a special command or warning whenever a nonhostile creature that it can see within 30 feet of it makes an attack roll or a saving throw. The creature can add a {@dice d4} to its roll provided it can hear and understand the knight. A creature can benefit from only one Leadership die at a time. This effect ends if the knight is {@condition incapacitated}.

action.name: Double-Bladed Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 3} to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) damage.

bonus.name: Double-Bladed Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) slashing damage.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The knight adds 2 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.
Valenar Knights are veteran-tier foes commonly that lead Valenar Warbands.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The priest is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 13}, {@hit 5} to hit with spell attacks). The priest has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Ancestral Guidance
entries: As a bonus action, the seer can expend a spell slot to cause its melee weapon attacks to magically deal an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) radiant damage to a target on a hit. This benefit lasts until the end of the turn. If the seer expends a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the extra damage increases by {@dice 1d6} for each level above 1st.

trait.name: Fey Ancestry
entries: The valenar seer has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed}, and magic can't put the valenar seer to sleep.

action.name: Mace
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.
Valenar Seers are adventure-tier foes found in Valenar warbands.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The druid is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 12}, {@hit 4} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following druid spells prepared:

action.name: Quarterstaff
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit ({@hit 4} to hit with shillelagh), reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage, 4 ({@damage 1d8}) bludgeoning damage if wielded with two hands, or 6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) bludgeoning damage with {@spell shillelagh}.

Druids dwell in forests and other secluded wilderness locations, where they protect the natural world from monsters and the encroachment of civilization. Some are tribal shamans who heal the sick, pray to animal spirits, and provide spiritual guidance.

trait.name: Gnome Cunning
entries: The gnome druid has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

trait.name: Pack Tactics
entries: The soldier has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the soldier's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't {@condition incapacitated}.

trait.name: Hard to Kill
entries: If damage reduces the soldier to 0 hit points, it must make a Constitution saving throw with a DC of 10 unless the damage is radiant or from a critical hit. On a success, the soldier drops to 1 hit point instead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The soldier attacks two times with one of its weapons.

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage

action.name: Longbow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

Undead soldiers form the elite core of the army of Karrnath. Fearless and tireless, they are a terrifying sight on the battlefield. With the end of the Last War, most Karrnathi undead have been sealed in vaults below the city of Atur. However, the Karrnathi army keeps numerous undead in its service, while others have been commandeered by the malevolent Order of the Emerald Claw.

entries.name: The Odakyr Rites
entries: The nation of Karrnath has a proud martial heritage, and its soldiers are unmatched in discipline. But in the early years of the Last War, Karrnath was crippled by famine and plague. In desperation, King Kaius I embraced the Blood of Vol, whose priests bolstered the armies of Karrnath with undead.

Initially, those skeletons and zombies required constant control and served as cannon fodder. Over decades, a high priest named Malevanor worked with the necromancers of the Blood of Vol to develop the Odakyr Rites, which grant Karrnathi undead the ability to make tactical decisions and operate without direct guidance.

The Odakyr Rites work only when performed on the remains of a soldier slain in battle, and only in manifest zones tied to the plane of Mabar. The most significant such zones in Karrnath exist in the cities of Atur and Odakyr (now called Fort Bones). The number of Karrnathi undead soldiers steadily increased over the course of the war, with the losses of Karrnath's living troops offset by the recovery and raising of their remains.

Malevanor claimed that Karrnathi undead are animated and granted intelligence by the patriotic spirit of Karrnath. However, many Karrns fear that the undead are vessels for a darker power—and that Lady Illmarrow or someone else will turn the undead against the living.

entries.name: Intelligent and Inhuman
entries: Karrnathi undead bear little resemblance to the people they were in life. These undead are content to stand motionless and silent for days. They show no emotion, and certainly no mercy or compassion. Undead soldiers kill any opposing forces—including civilians among those forces—unless given explicit instructions to the contrary.

A few exceptional Karrnathi undead retain their individuality and the memories of their former lives. Such undead are often found as champions of the Blood of Vol or agents of the Order of the Emerald Claw.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: A Karrnathi undead soldier doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The death knight is a 19th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 18}, {@hit 10} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The death knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Marshal Undead
entries: Unless the death knight is {@condition incapacitated}, it and undead creatures of its choice within 60 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against features that turn undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The death knight makes three Greatsword attacks.

action.name: Greatsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage, plus 8({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Hellfire Orb (1/Day)
entries: The death knight hurls a magical ball of fire that explodes at a point it can see within 120 feet of it. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes 14({@damage 4d6}) fire damage and 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The death knight adds 4 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the death knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

When a paladin that falls from grace dies without seeking atonement, dark powers can transform the once-mortal knight into a hateful undead creature. A death knight is a skeletal warrior clad in fearsome plate armor. Beneath its helmet, one can see the knight's skull with malevolent pinpoints of light burning in its eye sockets.

entries.name: Eldritch Power
entries: The death knight retains the ability to cast divine spells. However, no death knight can use its magic to heal. A death knight also attracts and commands lesser undead, although death knights that serve powerful fiends might have fiendish followers instead. Death knights often use warhorse skeletons and nightmares as mounts.

entries.name: Immortal Until Redeemed
entries: A death knight can arise anew even after it has been destroyed. Only when it atones for a life of wickedness or finds redemption can it finally escape its undead purgatory and truly perish.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: A death knight doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Lord Soth
entries: Lord Soth began his fall from grace with an act of heroism, saving an elf named Isolde from an ogre. Soth and Isolde fell in love, but Soth was already married. He had a servant dispose of his wife and was charged with murder, but fled with Isolde. When his castle fell under siege, he prayed for guidance and was told that he must atone for his misdeeds by completing a quest, but growing fears about Isolde's fidelity caused him to abandon his quest. Because his mission was not accomplished, a great cataclysm swept the land. When Isolde gave birth to a son, Soth refused to believe that the child was his and slew them both. All were incinerated in a fire that swept through the castle, yet Soth would find no rest in death, becoming a death knight.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The raptor has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

Raptors are hunting beasts favored by the Krolv.  They are blind but have both echolocation and a strong sense of smell that allows them to track their prey.  They are susceptible to psychic damage, and are easily controlled by the psionically gifted.

trait.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
entries: The raptor has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) piercing damage.

Raptors are hunting beasts favored by the Krolv.  They are blind but have both echolocation and a strong sense of smell that allows them to track their prey.  They are susceptible to psychic damage, and are easily controlled by the psionically gifted.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The krolv makes two attacks: two with its whip or two with its eldritch blast.

action.name: Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Eldritch Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) force damage.
The Krolv are space raiders that seek to pillage other dimensions to feed the World Eater.

bonus.name: Command
entries: As a bonus action, the Krolv Handler can command an Obsidian Raptor within 120 ft. to make a bite attack.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The krolv raider makes two attacks.

action.name: Halberd Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

bonus.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The krolv is an 8th level spellcaster.  its spellcasting ability is charisma (spell save DC  14, +6 to hit with spell attacks.  The krolv has the following spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The krolv makes three attacks.

action.name: +1 Halberd Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: +1 Halberd Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: +1 Halberd Hook
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) slashing damage.  If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Eldritch Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) force damage.
The Krolv are space raiders that seek to pillage other dimensions to feed the World Eater.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the centaur moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a halberd attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the krolv champion fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

bonus.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: The Krolv Champion makes one halberd attack.

legendary.name: Warrior's Stride
entries: The Krolv Champion moves up to their speed. This movement doesn't provoke opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Whirlwind (Cost 2 Actions)
entries: The Krolv Champion swings his halberd around viciously, attacking all creatures within reach.  Each creature must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Eldritch Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120 ft., two targets. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) force damage.
The Krolv are space raiders that seek to pillage other dimensions to feed the World Eater.

bonus.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The krolv is an 8th level spellcaster.  its spellcasting ability is charisma (spell save DC  14, +6 to hit with spell attacks.  The krolv has the following spells prepared:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The krolv raider makes three attacks.

action.name: Halberd Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Halberd Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Halberd Hook
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage.  If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Eldritch Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 5} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) force damage.
The Krolv are space raiders that seek to pillage other dimensions to feed the World Eater.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the centaur moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a halberd attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The krolv raider makes three attacks.

action.name: +1 Halberd Axe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: +1 Halberd Spear
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: +1 Halberd Hook
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) slashing damage.  If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Eldritch Blast
entries: {@atk rs} {@hit 6} to hit, range 120 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) force damage.
The Krolv are space raiders that seek to pillage other dimensions to feed the World Eater.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the centaur moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a halberd attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage.

bonus.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one {@condition prone} target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting (Psionics)
headerEntries: The Acolyte of Vorsevox casts one of the following spells, requiring no spell components and using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 18}):

trait.name: Creature Sense
entries: The Acolyte is aware of creatures within 5 miles of it that have an Intelligence score of 4 or higher. It knows the distance and direction to each creature, as well as each one's Intelligence score, but can't sense anything else about it. A creature protected by a {@spell mind blank} spell, a {@spell nondetection} spell, or similar magic can't be perceived in this manner.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the Acolyte fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The Acolyte has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Telepathic Hub
entries: The elder brain can use its telepathy to initiate and maintain telepathic conversations with up to ten creatures at a time. The elder brain can let those creatures telepathically hear each other while connected in this way.

action.name: Mind Blast {@recharge 5}
entries: Creatures of the elder brain's choice within 60 feet of it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Intelligence saving throw or take 32 ({@damage 5d10 + 5}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} for 1 minute. A target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

bonus.name: Psychic Link
entries: The elder brain targets one {@condition incapacitated} creature it senses with its Creature Sense trait and establishes a psychic link with the target. Until the link ends, the elder brain can perceive everything the target senses. The target becomes aware that something is linked to its mind once it is no longer {@condition incapacitated}, and the elder brain can terminate the link at any time (no action required). The target can use an action on its turn to attempt to break the link, doing so with a successful {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw. On a successful save, the target takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage. The link also ends if the target and the elder brain are more than 5 miles apart. The elder brain can form psychic links with up to ten creatures at a time.

bonus.name: Sense Thoughts
entries: The elder brain targets a creature with which it has a psychic link. The elder brain gains insight into the target's emotional state and foremost thoughts (including worries, loves, and hates).

legendary.name: Break Concentration
entries: The acolyte targets one creature within 120 feet of it with which it has a psychic link. The elder brain breaks the creature's concentration on a spell it has cast. The creature also takes 2 ({@damage 1d4}) psychic damage per level of the spell.

legendary.name: Psychic Pulse
entries: The acolyte targets one creature within 120 feet of it with which it has a psychic link. The target and enemies of the elder brain within 30 feet of target take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

legendary.name: Sever Psychic Link
entries: The acolyte targets one creature within 120 feet of it with which it has a psychic link. The elder brain ends the link, causing the creature to have disadvantage on all ability checks, attack rolls, and saving throws until the end of the creature's next turn.

legendary.name: Spellcasting (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Acolyte uses Spellcasting.
https://cache.desktopnexus.com/thumbseg/75/75394-bigthumbnail.jpg

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The necromancer casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The necromancer makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

action.name: Arcane Burst
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d10 + 3}) necrotic damage.

bonus.name: Summon Undead (1/Day)
entries: The necromancer magically summons five {@creature skeleton||skeletons} or {@creature zombie||zombies}. The summoned creatures appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of the necromancer, whom they obey. They take their turns immediately after the necromancer. Each lasts for 1 hour, until it or the necromancer dies, or until the necromancer dismisses it as a bonus action.

reaction.name: Grim Harvest (1/Turn)
entries: When the necromancer kills a creature with necrotic damage, the necromancer regains 9 ({@damage 2d8}) hit points.
Necromancers study the interaction of life, death, and undeath. Some necromancers dig up or purchase corpses to create Undead servitors. A few instead use their powers for good, hunting Undead.

entries.name: Wizards
entries: Wizards pursue magical power through the study of arcane texts. Some travel the world searching for esoteric tomes while others train lesser wizards or collaborate with colleagues to create new spells.

trait.name: Helm of Telepathy
entries: While wearing this helm, you can use an action to cast the detect thoughts spell (save {@dc 13}) from it. As long as you maintain concentration on the spell, you can use a bonus action to send a telepathic message to a creature you are focused on. It can reply—using a bonus action to do so—while your focus on it continues.

While focusing on a creature with detect thoughts, you can use an action to cast the suggestion spell (save {@dc 13}) from the helm on that creature. Once used, the suggestion property can't be used again until the next dawn.

trait.name: Pearl of Power
entries: While this pearl is on your person, you can use an action to speak its command word and regain one expended spell slot. If the expended slot was of 4th level or higher, the new slot is 3rd level. Once you have used the pearl, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

trait.name: Ring of Mind Shielding
entries: While wearing this ring, you are immune to magic that allows other creatures to read your thoughts, determine whether you are lying, know your alignment, or know your creature type. Creatures can telepathically communicate with you only if you allow it.
You can use an action to cause the ring to become {@condition invisible} until you use another action to make it visible, until you remove the ring, or until you die.

If you die while wearing the ring, your soul enters it, unless it already houses a soul. You can remain in the ring or depart for the afterlife. As long as your soul is in the ring, you can telepathically communicate with any creature wearing it. A wearer can't prevent this telepathic communication.

trait.name: Inferno Rope
entries: This 10-foot long rope smells of sulfur and crackles with embers when moved. As an action, you can lay the rope down in a line next to you on solid ground and speak its command word to magically set it ablaze. When you do, the rope becomes a 15-foot tall wall of fire along its length. The flames are visible, but not opaque, and are 1 inch thick. Creatures within 5 feet of the flames when it's ignited must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d4} fire damage. A creature setting the rope ablaze automatically succeeds on this saving throw. The flames burn for 1 minute and cast bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for another 15 feet. A creature must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw when it crosses the line of fire for the first time on its turn or ends its turn there. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 2d4} fire damage.

The rope rematerializes at the base of the flames after 1 minute. Once the rope has been lit, it can't be used again in this way until the next dawn. The rope can only be cut by magical means and becomes a nonmagical length of rope once cut.

trait.name: Thatrix's Spellbook
entries: If defeated, Thatrix's spellbook can be recovered.  The spellbook is protected by a {@spell Glyph of Warding||Spell Glyph} ({@dc 15} Intelligence (Arcana/Investigation) to detect, {@dc 15} to dispel) with {@spell Circle of Death} spell ({@dc 15}), which is triggered if anyone other than Thatrix opens it.
Animate Dead
Bestow Curse
Circle of Death
Dimension Door
Mage Armor
Speak with Dead
Summon Undead
Web

trait.name: Potion of Invisibility
entries: This potion's container looks empty but feels as though it holds liquid. When you drink it, you become {@condition invisible} for 1 hour. Anything you wear or carry is {@condition invisible} with you. The effect ends early if you attack or cast a spell.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The necromancer casts one of the following spells, using Intelligence as the spellcasting ability (spell save {@dc 15}):

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The necromancer makes three Arcane Burst attacks.

action.name: Arcane Burst
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 120 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 4d10 + 3}) necrotic damage.

bonus.name: Summon Undead (1/Day)
entries: The necromancer magically summons five {@creature skeleton||skeletons} or {@creature zombie||zombies}. The summoned creatures appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet of the necromancer, whom they obey. They take their turns immediately after the necromancer. Each lasts for 1 hour, until it or the necromancer dies, or until the necromancer dismisses it as a bonus action.

reaction.name: Grim Harvest (1/Turn)
entries: When the necromancer kills a creature with necrotic damage, the necromancer regains 9 ({@damage 2d8}) hit points.
Necromancers study the interaction of life, death, and undeath. Some necromancers dig up or purchase corpses to create Undead servitors. A few instead use their powers for good, hunting Undead.

entries.name: Wizards
entries: Wizards pursue magical power through the study of arcane texts. Some travel the world searching for esoteric tomes while others train lesser wizards or collaborate with colleagues to create new spells.

trait.name: Helm of Telepathy
entries: While wearing this helm, you can use an action to cast the detect thoughts spell (save {@dc 13}) from it. As long as you maintain concentration on the spell, you can use a bonus action to send a telepathic message to a creature you are focused on. It can reply—using a bonus action to do so—while your focus on it continues.

While focusing on a creature with detect thoughts, you can use an action to cast the suggestion spell (save {@dc 13}) from the helm on that creature. Once used, the suggestion property can't be used again until the next dawn.

trait.name: Pearl of Power
entries: While this pearl is on your person, you can use an action to speak its command word and regain one expended spell slot. If the expended slot was of 4th level or higher, the new slot is 3rd level. Once you have used the pearl, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries: While wearing this ring, you are immune to magic that allows other creatures to read your thoughts, determine whether you are lying, know your alignment, or know your creature type. Creatures can telepathically communicate with you only if you allow it.
You can use an action to cause the ring to become {@condition invisible} until you use another action to make it visible, until you remove the ring, or until you die.

If you die while wearing the ring, your soul enters it, unless it already houses a soul. You can remain in the ring or depart for the afterlife. As long as your soul is in the ring, you can telepathically communicate with any creature wearing it. A wearer can't prevent this telepathic communication.

trait.name: Inferno Rope
entries: This 10-foot long rope smells of sulfur and crackles with embers when moved. As an action, you can lay the rope down in a line next to you on solid ground and speak its command word to magically set it ablaze. When you do, the rope becomes a 15-foot tall wall of fire along its length. The flames are visible, but not opaque, and are 1 inch thick. Creatures within 5 feet of the flames when it's ignited must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take {@damage 2d4} fire damage. A creature setting the rope ablaze automatically succeeds on this saving throw. The flames burn for 1 minute and cast bright light in a 15-foot radius and dim light for another 15 feet. A creature must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw when it crosses the line of fire for the first time on its turn or ends its turn there. On a failure, the creature takes {@damage 2d4} fire damage.

The rope rematerializes at the base of the flames after 1 minute. Once the rope has been lit, it can't be used again in this way until the next dawn. The rope can only be cut by magical means and becomes a nonmagical length of rope once cut.

trait.name: Thatrix's Spellbook
entries: If defeated, Thatrix's spellbook can be recovered.  The spellbook is protected by a {@spell Glyph of Warding||Spell Glyph} ({@dc 15} Intelligence (Arcana/Investigation) to detect, {@dc 15} to dispel) with {@spell Circle of Death} spell ({@dc 15}), which is triggered if anyone other than Thatrix opens it.

trait.name: Potion of Invisibility
entries: This potion's container looks empty but feels as though it holds liquid. When you drink it, you become {@condition invisible} for 1 hour. Anything you wear or carry is {@condition invisible} with you. The effect ends early if you attack or cast a spell.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The death knight is a 6th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}, {@hit 8} to hit with spell attacks). It has the following paladin spells prepared:

spellcasting.name: Claw of Thengor
headerEntries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.
Commander's Courage.  While holding this sword, you are immune to being frightened.

This sword has 7 charges.  While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 or more of its charges to cast one of the following spells from it: aura of life (4 charges)cause fear (1 charges), crusader's mantle (3 charges), fear (3 charges), heroism (1 charge), or motivational speech (3 charges)
The sword regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The death knight has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Marshal Undead
entries: Unless the death knight is {@condition incapacitated}, it and undead creatures of its choice within 60 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against features that turn undead.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The death knight makes two Longsword attacks.

action.name: Longsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 1d8 + 6}) slashing damage, plus 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Hellfire Orb {@recharge 5}
entries: The death knight hurls a magical ball of fire that explodes at a point it can see within 120 feet of it. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on that point must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. The sphere spreads around corners. A creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) fire damage and 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

reaction.name: Parry
entries: The Zolan adds 4 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the death knight must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

When a paladin that falls from grace dies without seeking atonement, dark powers can transform the once-mortal knight into a hateful undead creature. A death knight is a skeletal warrior clad in fearsome plate armor. Beneath its helmet, one can see the knight's skull with malevolent pinpoints of light burning in its eye sockets.

entries.name: Eldritch Power
entries: The death knight retains the ability to cast divine spells. However, no death knight can use its magic to heal. A death knight also attracts and commands lesser undead, although death knights that serve powerful fiends might have fiendish followers instead. Death knights often use warhorse skeletons and nightmares as mounts.

entries.name: Immortal Until Redeemed
entries: A death knight can arise anew even after it has been destroyed. Only when it atones for a life of wickedness or finds redemption can it finally escape its undead purgatory and truly perish.

entries.name: Undead Nature
entries: A death knight doesn't require air, food, drink, or sleep.

entries.name: Lord Soth
entries: Lord Soth began his fall from grace with an act of heroism, saving an elf named Isolde from an ogre. Soth and Isolde fell in love, but Soth was already married. He had a servant dispose of his wife and was charged with murder, but fled with Isolde. When his castle fell under siege, he prayed for guidance and was told that he must atone for his misdeeds by completing a quest, but growing fears about Isolde's fidelity caused him to abandon his quest. Because his mission was not accomplished, a great cataclysm swept the land. When Isolde gave birth to a son, Soth refused to believe that the child was his and slew them both. All were incinerated in a fire that swept through the castle, yet Soth would find no rest in death, becoming a death knight.

legendary.name: Attack
entries: Zolan makes one longsword attack.

legendary.name: Hellfire Orb (Costs 2 Actions)
entries: The Zolan recharges Hellfire Orb and immediately uses it.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the unicorn moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a horn attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Horn
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Healing Touch (3/day)
entries: Healing Touch (3/Day). The unicorn touches another creature with its horn. The target magically regains 11 ({@dice 2d8 + 2}) hit points. In addition, the touch removes all diseases and neutralizes all poisons afflicting the target.

A nightmare appears in a cloud of roiling smoke, its mane, tail, and hooves wreathed in flame. The creature's unearthly black form moves with supernatural speed, vanishing in a cloud of brimstone as quickly as it appeared.

entries.name: Dread Steed
entries: Also called a "demon horse" or "hell horse," the nightmare serves as a steed for creatures of exceptional evil, carrying demons, devils, death knights, liches, night hags, and other vile monsters. It resembles a fiendish horse, and a nightmare's fiery red eyes betray its malevolent intelligence. A nightmare can be summoned from the Lower Planes, but unless a worthy sacrifice is offered to it as food upon its arrival, the nightmare displays no special loyalty to the creature it serves.

entries.name: Creating a Nightmare
entries: Nightmares don't appear naturally in the multiverse. They must be created from pegasi. The ritual that creates a nightmare requires the torturous removal of a pegasus's wings, driving that noble creature to evil as it is transformed by dark magic.

trait.name: Charge
entries: If the Firebelcher moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a slam attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 ({@damage 2d8}) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or be knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Heated Body
entries: A creature that touches the fire belcher or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) fire damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fire belcher makes three melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) piercing damage and 5 ({@damage 2d4}) fire damage.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage and 5 ({@damage 2d4}) fire damage.

action.name: Fire Breath {@recharge 5}
entries: The fire belcher exhales fire in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking {@h}16 ({@damage 3d10}) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The fanatic is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, {@hit 7} to hit with spell attacks). The fanatic has the following cleric spells prepared:

trait.name: Dark Devotion
entries: The fanatic has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The fanatic makes two melee attacks.

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one creature. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Lightning Orb (9/day)
entries: Nebra shoots out a ball of lightning, which explodes in a 10-foot radius.  Each creature within the radius must make a Dexterity saving throw ({@dc 15}), taking {@damage 4d6} lightning damage on a failed saving throw, or half as much on a success.  Each use consumes one Hit Die.
Fanatics are often part of a cult's leadership, using their charisma and dogma to influence and prey on those of weak will. Most are interested in personal power above all else

monster.name: Cultist Mob

trait.name: Dark Devotion
entries: The cultist has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Swarm
entries: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a Small humanoid. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

trait.name: Deafening Clatter
entries: Creatures are {@condition deafened} while in the swarm's space.

action.name: Lynch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. {@h}17 ({@damage 4d6 + 3}) slashing damage or 10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

Cultists swear allegiance to dark powers such as elemental princes, demon lords, or archdevils. Most conceal their loyalties to avoid being ostracized, imprisoned, or executed for their beliefs. Unlike evil acolytes, cultists often show signs of insanity in their beliefs and practices.

actionHeader: Multiattack.  The Cultist Swarm gets 4 attacks per turn
